text: Viktor Alonen (born 21 March 1969) is an Estonian professional footballer, who currently plays for Türi Ganvix JK. He spent the prime years of his career playing for Flora Tallinn. ==International career== He won a total of 71 international caps for the Estonia national football team during the 90s. Alonen earned his first official cap as a substitute on 1992-06-03, when Estonia played Slovenia in a friendly match. He played his last game for the national team in the 2002 World Cup qualifier against Portugal in 2001.Alonen leaves FC Kuressaare (meiemaa.ee) ==External links== * Profile ==References== Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Estonian footballers Category:Estonia international footballers Category:FC Flora players Category:Viljandi JK Tulevik players Category:FC Kuressaare players Category:Sportspeople from Viljandi Category:Association football midfielders
title: Viktor Alonen
